column3: Concept ACK. Confirmed changes to verify.sh are working\n
Fixed @fanquake 's nit, cherry-picked #7882 into this.\n
utACK cdb7804\n
utACK cdb7804\n
squashed 2873dbd 3707e43 373bfef 6e25333 cdb7804 into c907f4d 182bec4 f154470\n.\n
Should we use {VERSION} here in place of hard coded numbers \n
Sure!\n
You can't add a new line here and keep the pre-whitespace. This will mess with the formatting\n
This should probably be a - list \n

I always end up doing something like
git commit -a -S -m "${SIGNER}'s unsigned gitian build for ${VERSION}"

The extra -S is probably unnecessary because we end signing a commit containing signed files, but I don't think it should hurt anything and GPG already has to be set up correctly for gsign to work.
Are you sure this is no longer required here?\n
If you add this, you'd need to add `pushd ./gitian-builder` at the other places? \n
You'd need to `git config ...` for `git commit -S` to work\n
There's not really a need to sign commits with signatures in them, I think that'll just result in confusion which signatures are used.\n
The verifies? They're still there, this is just a formatting change\n
Yes using pushd/popd consistently everywhere would make sense.\n
No, the popd\n
Well if there should be a popd it should at least be balanced by a pushd. Out of the blue it is very strange.\n
You have moved it up instead. See my other comment above ;)\n
I think they were "balanced" before. (Not necessarily in each section, though) \n
Hah, okay, having pushd/popd open over sections is weird, I must have not been the only one to never get that point. I'll add a pushd and popd around this.\n
